user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_create_response_from_pipe:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_from_pipe (int fd)
{
  struct MHD_Response *response;

  response = MHD_create_response_from_callback (MHD_SIZE_UNKNOWN,
                                                MHD_FILE_READ_BLOCK_SIZE,
                                                &pipe_reader,
                                                NULL,
                                                &free_callback);
  if (NULL == response)
    return NULL;
  response->fd = fd;
  response->is_pipe = true;
  response->crc_cls = response;
  return response;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No unreachable code fragments were found in the provided function. Reasoning:
- Control flow is straightforward: call MHD_create_response_from_callback, check its return value, and either return NULL (when response is NULL) or execute the subsequent assignments and return response. Both the early return and the later return are reachable depending on the result of the called function.
- There are no statements after an unconditional return, no dead branches, no loops that never exit, and no switch/case constructs that would introduce unreachable labels.
- The _MHD_EXTERN macro only affects linkage/visibility and does not introduce unreachable code in the function body.
- All variables and parameters used (response, fd) are referenced in reachable code paths.

Therefore there are no code fragments in this function that warrant investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 (unreachable code).
